intro: Lepidocaryum macrocarpum, commonly known as the large-seeded spurge, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny, and often branched stems. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers clustered in complex inflorescences called cyathia. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a waxy coating. Lepidocaryum macrocarpum is adapted to grow in a variety of habitats, including disturbed soils and open areas.
